Details.Name: Calendar
Details.Title: Calendar
Details.BodyCopy:
Meetings are held on the third Sunday of the month. Locations and times to be announced via e-mail and Facebook. 

January 19, 2014 Tour of Burke Museum Avian Specimen Collection, University of Washington

February 16, 2014 Covington Starbucks -- Topic: Website Working Meeting On Our New www.wogbb.com Website 

March 16, 2014 Skagit River Delta Snow Goose Migration Viewing and Tour of member Maynard Axelson's Farm, Mt. Vernon, WA

April 10-13, 2014 Event: Spring Fair at Washington State Fairgrounds in Puyallup

Note: There will be no formal meeting in April. Visit our booth and display birds located across from the petting zoo.



May 18, 2014 Meeting at member Kathy Fries home and aviary tour, Kirkland. Time: 2PM. Bring something for the potluck lunch.

June 22, 2014 Still in planning process: More coming soon...

July 13, 2014 Event Members are invited to attend or participate in an event at Auburn's Mary Olson Farm Museum. Club members (led by Craig Holmes) will be giving a presentation on game birds traditionally raised at the site. Come visit the display pens. Directions and Hours

July 20, 2014 No formal meeting in July

August 17, 2014 Fair Show Pens Building and Repair Work Party

September 5th - 9th, 2014 Event: Washington State Fair in Puyallup -- WOGBB Club Booth and Bird Display. Visit our birds at the Animals of the World exhibit during the first five days of the fair, including opening weekend.

September 21, 2014 UW Burke Museum Bird Specimen & Ornithology Collection Visit with John Klicka. Time: TBA.

October 19, 2014 Meeting at member The Schouten's home and aviary tour, Port Angeles, WA

November 16, 2014 Cabella's Tulalip Store in Marysville, WA -- Store Location 9810 Quil Ceda Blvd., Tulalip, WA 98271

December 14, 2014 Holiday Party and Potluck -- NOTE: Meeting is held on the SECOND Sunday in December

Winter 2015 Activities:

Community Service Project: Put up WOGBB sponsored Wood Duck boxes at area lakes.

Avian Veterinarian visit. Have all of your bird health questions answered.
